title: Chapter 460
content: Grid stepped forward. His voice cut through the stadium. "I will obtain the title of the strongest." The Stade de France erupted. Sixty thousand throats roared at once. The sound hit like a physical wave. "Grid! Grid! Grid!" "Does he think he can beat Kraugel?" "Arrogant bastard!" The cheers were outnumbered. Jeers drowned them out. Kraugel's faithful packed the stands—millions more watched the broadcast. He was the untouchable peak. The genius no one dared envy. He stood alone in a category the world had invented just for him. Objectively, Grid was outmatched. Everyone knew it. The man didn't understand what he'd challenged. The crowd noise swelled into chaos. Kraugel spoke. "This time, I won't lose." His jaw tightened. "No. I can never lose." Silence dropped like a guillotine blade. The stadium held its breath. Sixty thousand people froze. *This time I won't lose?* *This time?* *It can't be.* The implication hung in the air, impossible to dismiss. Kraugel had already lost to Grid. When? How? The questions had no time to form answers. The system notification materialized. > [The match will now begin.] No fanfare. No host announcement. Just cold text. Grid moved. His heart hammered against his ribs. *Pagma's Swordsmanship.* "White Light Steps." Kraugel's expression hardened into something grim. They exploded into motion simultaneously. Grid's footwork painted crimson trails across the stage—each step a brushstroke of blood-red light. Kraugel moved differently. Elegant. Economical. He blurred at the edges and vanished. The skill was called White Light Steps. It boosted movement speed, enhanced terrain adaptation, functioned as both dash and dodge depending on mastery. Under direct sunlight or moonlight, it granted stealth. The sun blazed overhead. Kraugel's element. "He disappeared!" "Where did he go?" The spectators leaned forward in their seats. Eyes scanned the empty space where Kraugel had been. Any second now, he'd materialize behind Grid. One strike. That's all it would take. Grid began his sword dance. The words left his lips between flowing movements. "Magic Detection. Link." Not the standard spell. Braham's version—rewritten from first principles. Casting time minimized. Effect maximized. Kraugel's position snapped into Grid's awareness like a compass finding north. Dozens of energy blades screamed through the air. The ambush failed. Kraugel pivoted to defense. *Chaeng!* *Chaeeeeeng!* Fast. Brutal. Iyarugt's crimson glow clashed with White Fang's pale luminescence. They traded blows multiple times per second. The collision birthed a storm of steel and light. Sparks showered the stage, scorching the synthetic surface. The display mesmerized the crowd—two masters at the absolute peak of their craft. The commentators fell silent. Even Peak Sword of OGC couldn't track the movements. Jishuka's eyes darted between the fighters. *This is crazy.* As the godly archer with maxed Agility and Hawk Eyes, only she could follow them. Barely. If either turned on her, she'd be dead before the counterattack formed in her mind. "It isn't just fast." She spoke to herself, awed. "The sword's orbits keep changing..." Kraugel earned his nickname honestly. Godly Control—a title reserved for those who transcended human limitations. But Grid? When had Grid reached this level? *Did he grow again during this competition?* Jishuka's mind reeled. *He faced the strongest PvP fighters in the world and came out stronger.* *Jjejeong!* The final strike of **Link** launched both fighters backward. They slid to opposite ends of the stage. Their gazes locked. Kraugel felt only admiration. *He's incomparably stronger than before.* Grid's thoughts were less serene. *Crazy... He blocked that skill like it was nothing?* Kraugel hadn't just defended. He'd redirected each strike of **Link**, weakening the trajectory, turning Grid's own momentum against him. *Is this even human?* The comparison clicked into place. Piaro—in his prime as a Great Swordsman—had fought Kraugel in Reidan. Piaro had called him "a genius eligible to become a Sword Saint." No surprise there. *I can never win a pure physical fight.* Grid's strategy shifted. *Need to use crowd control.* The **God Hands** materialized as Grid activated **Restraint**. The plan was simple. The floating hands would occupy Kraugel while Grid completed the skill's casting sequence. It worked. The **God Hands** wielded their weapons and fired **Magic Missiles**. Kraugel wasted precious seconds dealing with them—approximately 1.5. **Restraint** completed. Then a ring on Kraugel's hand flared with light. > [The target has resisted the 'overwhelmed' effect!] Grid's jaw clenched. "Items!" Of course. Overgeared wasn't a Legendary Class exclusive to Grid. Kraugel had run more raids, cleared more dungeons, survived more impossible quests than anyone. His equipment collection included dozens of resistance accessories. Kraugel closed the distance. White Fang came in low, angled toward Grid's heart. The **Heart Selection** passive activated—guaranteeing the strike would hit a vital point. But Grid had counters. The Slaughterer's Eye Patch showed him the trajectory. Iyarugt moved to intercept. *Jjejeong!* The blades met again. > [The experience of Iyarugt has increased by 0.1%!] Grid gasped. *Just one exchange gave that much experience?* The quality of Kraugel's swordsmanship factored in, yes. But the level gap between them played a larger role. *Anyway, thank you!* His mind raced. *If I can hold out, maybe Iyarugt will rank up mid-fight. Then I can turn this around—* > [You have suffered 2,100 damage.] Pain lanced through his side. Grid's eyes widened. *When did he—?* A dagger. Kraugel had drawn a second blade—this one engraved with a dragon's tail motif. Now he fought with White Fang in his right hand, the dagger in his left. *Jjejeong!* *Jjeejeeeong!* "Kuh—" Grid bit back the grunt of pain. The dual-wielding style transformed Kraugel's offense. The gap between strikes vanished. The sword paths became labyrinthine. Attacks came from angles more irregular than Regas's Taekwondo combinations. Grid couldn't keep up. He started taking hits. > [You have suffered 1,950 damage.] > [You have suffered 5,130 damage.] The dagger damage was manageable. Tiramet's Belt had recently increased in rating. And Grid wore Triple Layers—the strongest armor in existence. White Fang was the problem. Grid knew that sword intimately. +9 True White Fang. If Kraugel landed three consecutive hits, the combo would cripple Grid. He tried to interrupt the chain. Failed. > [You have suffered 4,900 damage.] > [Your weakness is exposed!] > [Doran's Ring has been equipped.] > [You were hit by a sharp cut and suffered 12,900 damage!] > [Health has been absorbed due to the option effect of Doran's Ring.] Blood sprayed. Grid coughed, crimson flecking his lips. The wounds multiplied across his body. The crowd's murmur built into a wave. "The battle turned one-sided so fast..." "Grid's better than I expected, but it's over now." "Of course! The sky above the sky won't fall to some upstart!" Strength was always relative. Grid had demonstrated excellence throughout the competition. But standing before the peak, he looked diminished. Ordinary. They were wrong. The crowd kept forgetting. Grid couldn't be measured by normal standards. "Haaap!" Grid took another strike deliberately. His hand shot upward. One of the **God Hands** flew to meet his grasp and placed Grid's Greatsword into his grip. > [The +8 Grid's Greatsword has been equipped as a secondary weapon.] > [Only 50% of the weapon's attack power is applied due to the double wielding penalty.] > [Grid's Greatsword has increased attack power by 30% and skill damage by 20%.] Grid knew dual-wielding too. Iyarugt in his right hand. Grid's Greatsword in his left. He met Kraugel's two-blade style with his own. Kraugel's eyes narrowed. *This attack speed... with a greatsword?* How high was Grid's Agility? And that blue-black blade—it didn't suffer the normal attack speed penalty at all. *Jjejeong!* The force of Grid's assault lifted Kraugel off his feet. Strength won out over technique. Kraugel's body flew backward, his control momentarily lost. Grid saw the opening. **Pagma's Swordsmanship, Pinnacle Kill.** The targeted skill. Unavoidable once activated. Kraugel recognized the technique—he'd analyzed its properties. Defense was meaningless against its armor-penetrating power. A counterattack was his only option. *I can't let this land.* The attack power was too high. Kraugel's counter skill was ordinary—it wouldn't overcome **Pinnacle Kill**'s momentum. *Should I use Super Sensitivity?* He hesitated. This fight would go long. Wasting his trump card now could cost him the match. His decision came in a fraction of a second. A close-range kick. "Jajinmori." *Peeeeeong!* The charged strike slammed into Grid's abdomen with perfect precision. But Grid didn't budge. **Pinnacle Kill** continued its execution. Kraugel's expression twisted. A **God Hand** had blocked the kick at the last instant. *Seokeok!* The empowered stab punched through Kraugel's abdomen. *Puok!* Blood erupted skyward. Red droplets fell like rain. The world held its breath.
